1. Open Tasker and go to Tasks
2. Create a new task and give it a name
3. Add the Send Intent action from the System group
4. Paste the below intent into Action
5. Set the package name to com.franco.kernel
6. Save the task
Error trying to download the kernel

Studies show that exposure to blue light in the evening can affect your circadian rhythms and make it harder to fall asleep. Night Shift shifts the colors of your display to the warmer end of the color spectrum after dark. This may help you sleep better.
Really delete %s? You can\'t get it back.
There\'s already a profile with that name
Headphones power amp gain: left channel
Headphones power amp gain: right channel
Your kernel doesn\'t support Night Shift
Your kernel doesn\'t support high brightness mode
Simple suggestions & hints to improve your battery life.\nTap the cards and menus for more information.

Lowering the CPU clocks will greatly increase your screen on time at the expense of performance. Most of the device\'s operations aren\'t really CPU intensive so lowering it at least 25% is enough to greatly reduce power consumption.\nThere are several instances in which this will show the device as \"underclocked\" even though you haven\'t applied this previously, the most notable being thermal throttling (if this is the case you won\'t be able to restore to the default clocks, your device handles it for you automatically), or your rom/kernel has underclocked the CPU by default.

Most operations don\'t need any real GPU computation, but every time the framebuffer refreshes the GPU core needs to come out of sleep. Some implementations even ramp up the GPU for every touch input. Reducing the maximum GPU clock can also provide some great power consumption reduction, without adding jank

Tightly integrated with FK, this profile changes the CPU, GPU, input boost frequency and duration, and sometimes (depending on the device) it also changes governor parameters. This profile is very aggressive and you might experience some jank here and there, but the power consumption reduction during screen on will be immense

Disabling automatic background syncing has two sides of the coin. For one, disabling it will certainly reduce needlessly idle wakeups (when doze isn\'t active), but then you\'ll lose some features, such as announces for new e-mails when they arrive on your inbox, and other pieces that constantly backup/query online services. It really depends on your usage and needs

If you want to go deep into the rabbit hole you can create custom power profiles to be applied on a per-app basis.\nSocial network apps, or Maps, news, or generally anything heavily text based without fancy elements or crazy animations will work fine on a very restrictive power profile. Since these can be applied for each app, you can leave your system defaults on all the time, and then when you open an app with a profile bound to it, let\'s say Messages, the profile will kick in and apply your settings while you\'re using it. As soon as you leave the app, the settings will go back to defaults.\nIt\'s very powerful and you can create a very unique and personal experience

With Naptime by toggling in the \"Aggressive doze\" option Doze will kick in right after you screen off AND it disables your sensors so that it doesn\'t kick you out from Doze mode if you move around. When your device screens on everything goes back to normal. It\'s just like magic, providing you an amazing idle batter life

The display is one of the two components that use the most power. Even with adaptive brightness the panel will reach high nits of light, sometimes unnecessarily. By reducing the maximum value it can achieve you\'ll save some very precious battery when you need it the most.
Root access seems to be missing
FK Kernel Manager requires root access to be used.\n\nHowever the Battery Monitor feature works without root so you can access it from the button below
Nothing to see here if Naptime isn\'t installed
Nothing to see here if Servicely isn\'t installed
Something really wrong happened, but we\'re not sure what :|
Some error happened when trying to save the profile. Try to set it up again from scratch. Sorry!
The value needs to be higher than 0 up to a maximum of 100
Automagically put all apps into App Standby after screen off. Plus other powerful feature to disable any service in any app in your device.

Wrote the current version of the auto-flasher feature (probably the only implementation in the world) and developer of the popular AnyKernel2 flashing mechanism. Without his contributions this app\'s primary feature wouldn\'t be possible

High brightness mode allows the display's brightness to go above the maximum stock value.
This is particularly useful in direct sunlight, although it shouldn't be used for long periods since it increases the chance for burn-in on OLED displays and consumes way more battery.

The automatic feature will analyze the environment ambient light and activate high brightness mode if your surroundings are brighter than the threshold you set. It automatically turns off if the light is below it
This app needs permission to write into the internal sdcard to function properly
Controls Night Shift goes on or off
Detects which app is in the foreground and applies your Per-app profiles accordingly
Location permission is required to figure out the approximate sunset and sunrise times.\nIt\'s a very low power location request only once every sunset/sunrise transition.
Pick the amount you\'re comfortable with

The supporter program is a simple & quick way for amazing users like you to make an additional show of support recognizing the value this app provides (remember all the battery life I helped you save?).

Part of these proceedings are shared with others, such as the designer who made these wallpapers. Supporting me means supporting them too.

As a "thank you" you'll have this banner displayed in the Help & Support section and you'll have access to 4 exclusive never seen before wallpapers for your device. The wallpapers are accessible by clicking the banner at the Help & Support section.
Are you sure you want to delete this?
There was an error when saving the file to internal storage

With BetterBatteryStats you can analyse the behavior of your phone, find apps causing the phone to drain battery while it is supposed to be asleep and measure the effect of corrective actions:
· Spot drainers based on detailed information about the root cause
· measure the effect of actions to reduce drain, following a simple method
· detect changes in the awake/sleep profile and quickly find the causes (rogue apps)

In other words BetterBatteryStats helps you achieve the best experience with your device!
Nothing to see here if BetterBatteryStats isn\'t installed

Profiles saved to /sdcard/franco.kernel_updater/governor_profiles\nIt creates a snapshot of all your governor parameters and saves it into a file that can be shared anywhere. You can also get profiles and place them on this directory so they\'ll show up here.
A profile with this name already exists
This is used to trigger per-app profiles based on the active app.\n\nThis service will never read your screen. You can ask for the code powering this service for transparency.
Would you like to contribute a tiny bit more and help me keep up with server costs and support more devices? You\'ll win a badass looking medal, 4 custom wallpapers and my forever gratitude!

This tries to accurately "guess" the battery used per hour while under usage or during idle. The longer this service is left running the more accurate it gets.
Active idle is calculated based on your screen on time and the % lost while the display is turned on.
Idle drain is calculated based on how much % is lost any time the display is off.
Scenarios when the collected stats reset:
 · The device reboots;
 · It's charged to 100%;
 · When it's unplugged from the charger.
These scenarios will help the battery data to be fresh and relevant to your current usage
Notify me if idle drain percentage goes higher than 5%
The battery monitor service detected your device is losing an average of 5% per hour. You should make sure you don\'t have any rogue apps waking your device from idle
The battery temperature unit will be updated the next time the notification refreshes
Unfortunately there\'s no automation available for your device/kernel configuration /sadface
Your device/kernel combination doesn\'t support any display control feature
Enter the file path of the tunable you want to add
Reset the stats when the device is plugged in
Set a description for this item
The description can\'t be the same
Write a note about this tunable to help you remember what it is, what values it ranges from, etc.

This feature is for advanced users - blocking wakelocks is solely your own responsibility and if you break anything by doing it then you're on your own.

That said, the only thing that can really break is an app (that really needs that wakelock to function) or some vital system functionality which needs the wakelock to do something periodically during idle.

You can check for your Wakelocks using BetterBatteryStats or any other similar app
This wakelock is already being blocked
You\'re currently not blocking any wakelocks.\n\nIf you\'re having idle drain install BetterBatteryStats (it\'s free from XDA) and check which wakelocks are doing it and then block them here
Do you have an idea you want to see implemented - or a suggestion? You\'re in the right place!
You haven\'t yet added a description for this item
All messages in the kernel log will be cleared

Night Shift settings can and might be affected by the manufacturer\'s implementations. For example Night Shift won\'t work on the OnePlus 6 unless you have Adaptive Display enabled. LiveDisplay by LineageOS might affect this feature too. Just be wary of this
You need to have the Battery Monitor service running to gather stats
Dialog with an auto-updating flashing log. Particularly useful for debugging.\nLogs are automatically saved into /sdcard/franco.kernel_updater/logs/

Amperage and voltage depends on the charger & cable that you\'re using. These charging values can also be affected by your usage, device heat and/or battery temperature. This feature simply reads the values from the kernel, but they might not a 100% accurate representation of the real electricity current so take these as an estimation.\nIf for some reason these stats don\'t show up then it\'s likely your device has different paths. Contact me and we\'ll figure it out together
You can\'t offline CPU0 because it\'s essential and vital to the device\'s functions
Disabling cores is a quick and dirty way to save power, though performance will be impacted
This tip has already been applied
This tip has been set on boot
Add your backup note below (like if you need to add some information about this particular kernel backup)
You can\'t add an empty note
Are you sure you want to restore this kernel?
Are you sure you want to restore this kernel backup? The kernel will be available after a reboot
Disabling zRAM, this may take a while…
Resizing zRAM, this may take a while…
There isn\'t any string with that search term
Welcome to the new Per-app profiles experience

Below you\'ll choose between two different ways to create and manage your app profiles.\nIf this is the first time you\'re using this feature I strongly recommend trying the \"Simple mode\" first.\nYou can change your choice later at Settings if you wish.
You\'ll be guided through all the steps with descriptions along the way
All the options will be displayed right away with no descriptions. This mode assumes you\'ve made profiles before and are used to this feature
To start things off, you need to enable the background service that applies profiles
Choose the app that the profile will affect. You can change this later.

One of the most important setting, and likely the option that\'ll save you the most battery. Each device has a minimum frequency and a maximum frequency, and depending on the system load the freq will scale up and down. Depending on the app you\'ve chosen it may be wise to lower the max frequency to save battery.\n\nFor example if you\'re using Google Maps your device is using lots of battery with GPS, the display, all the sensors, so setting a lower max freq it\'ll help you not run out of juice as fast.
Set maximum frequency for low power CPUs
Set maximum frequency for high performance CPUs
Change the maximum frequency for your CPUs

Same as with the CPU maximum frequency, the GPU works exactly the same way. If what you\'re doing isn\'t graphically intensive there\'s no real need to allow the GPU to scale so high and use more power.\n\nGeneral rule of thumb you can set a lower than max GPU freq unless you\'re applying this profile to a game ✨

You'll likely not need WiFi or GPS when reading a book through the Kindle app, or you want to use the phone in a certain orientation specifically for that one app.

All the settings you'll choose below are applied when the app you've selected is opened.

To proceed and save this profile you must choose settings for WiFi, GPS, display orientation and Android battery saver and they'll appear below sequentially. If you don't want to change any of these settings just leave them at "Unchanged" and you're good to go 👍
Stop the wizard and return to the initial menu

Thank you so much for becoming a FK Kernel Manager Supporter!

As a constant reminder of your generous support, you'll proudly display a Supporter badge banner in the Help menu! And more, clicking the banner gives you access to the amazing custom wallpapers.

Thanks again!
Flashing can\'t proceed, there seems to be a problem with the built-in busybox. Probably a good idea to contact me on Twitter

Show battery % as a notification icon
Reset the stats when the device reboots or it\'s shutdown
Cannot fetch a last location. Open Google Maps to force the device into locking into the GPS for you.
Reset the stats when the battery reaches a certain percentage
New r%1$d is ready to be flashed!
A switch to enable or disable Klapse
The hour at which klapse should start scaling the RGB values from daytime to target (see next points)
The hour by which klapse should scale back the RGB values from target to daytime (see next points)
The RGB set that must be used for all the time outside of start and stop hour range
The RGB set that must be scaled towards for all the time inside of start and stop hour range

Controls how soon the RGB reaches from daytime to target inside of start and stop hour range. Once target is reached, it remains constant till 30 minutes before stop hour, where target RGB scales back to daytime RGB

From the name itself, this value has the ability to bend perception and make your display appear as if it is at a lesser brightness level than it actually is at. It works by reducing the RGB values by the same factor
[2, 10] (10 means accurate brightness, 5 means 50% of current brightness, etc)
A switch that allows you to automatically set the brightness factor in a set time range
The hour at which brightness_factor should be applied. Depends on brightness_factor_auto = 1.
The hour at which brightness_factor should be reverted to 10. Depends on brightness_factor_auto = 1.
The brightness range within which klapse should scale from daytime to target_rgb. Depends on enable_klapse = 2.
[2, 1023] (first value is lower and second is upper, lower being smaller than upper must be true)
The amount of milliseconds after which klapse_pulse is called. A more developer-targeted tunable. Depends on enable_klapse = 1 OR brightness_factor_auto = 1
The number of minutes before klapse_stop_hour when RGB should start going back to daytime_rgb. Depends on enable_klapse = 1.
Shell scripts are stored in /sdcard/franco.kernel_updater/scripts/\nImported scripts are copied to that location as well
Copied the full path to the clipboard
r%1$d is available and ready to be flashed
Information about how this feature works
Still loading the log, wait a moment
Offline - can\'t check for kernel updates
Resetting zRAM to apply the new compression algorithm, this may take a while…
This backs up all the \"set on boot\" settings you\'ve saved across the app, along with other app settings
This overwrites the current preferences file with the settings from the backup.\nIt\'s irreversible (well unless you backed the settings beforehand) so be sure before you go through.

There's a few more stats available, but you need to manually grant special permissions with ADB:

1. adb -d shell pm grant com.franco.kernel android.permission.DUMP
2. adb -d shell pm grant com.franco.kernel android.permission.PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS
3. Manually force close the app
4. Voilá 🙌
Link your scripts to quick tiles to easily run them without opening the app
